DAGArrayInputAlias.description:
A JSON array input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html for
more information.

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.
annotations.title: Annotations

platform.description: Name of the client platform (e.g. Grasshopper, Revit, etc). The value can be any strings as long as it has been agreed between client-side developer and author of the recipe.
platform.title: Platform

handler.description: List of process actions to process the input or output value.
handler.title: Handler

default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.
default.title: Default

required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.
required.title: Required

spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.
spec.title: Spec

items_type.description: Type of items in an array.

DAGArrayInputAlias.title: DAGArrayInputAlias

DAGBooleanInputAlias.description:
The boolean type matches only two special values: True and False.

Note that values that evaluate to true or false, such as 1 and 0, are not accepted.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/boolean.html for more
information.

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.
annotations.title: Annotations

platform.description: Name of the client platform (e.g. Grasshopper, Revit, etc). The value can be any strings as long as it has been agreed between client-side developer and author of the recipe.
platform.title: Platform

handler.description: List of process actions to process the input or output value.
handler.title: Handler

default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.
default.title: Default

required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.
required.title: Required

spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.
spec.title: Spec

DAGBooleanInputAlias.title: DAGBooleanInputAlias

DAGFileInputAlias.description:
An alias file input.

File is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a file will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.
annotations.title: Annotations

platform.description: Name of the client platform (e.g. Grasshopper, Revit, etc). The value can be any strings as long as it has been agreed between client-side developer and author of the recipe.
platform.title: Platform

handler.description: List of process actions to process the input or output value.
handler.title: Handler

default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.
default.title: Default

required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.
required.title: Required

spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.
spec.title: Spec

extensions.description: Optional list of extensions for file.
extensions.title: Extensions

DAGFileInputAlias.title: DAGFileInputAlias

        "maxLength": 50,
    }

DAGGenericInputAlias.description:
Base class for DAG Alias inputs.

This class adds a handler to input to handle the process of loading the input
from different graphical interfaces.

DAGLinkedInputAlias.description:
An Alias for Linked Inputs.

A linked input alias will be hidden in the UI and will be linked to an object in 
the UI using the input handler.

DAGPathInputAlias.description:
A file or a folder input.

Use this input only in cases that the input can be either a file or folder. For file
or folder-only inputs see File and Folder.

Path is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a path will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/string.html#string for
more information.

.. code-block:: python

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

    "schema": {
        "type": "string",
        "maxLength": 50,
        "pattern": "(?i)(^.*\.epw$)"
    }

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.

handler.description: List of process actions to process the input or output value.
handler.title: Handler

default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.
default.title: Default

required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.
required.title: Required

spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.
spec.title: Spec

extensions.description: Optional list of extensions for path.
extensions.title: Extensions

DockerConfig.description: Plugin Configuration to run in a Docker container

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.
annotations.title: Annotations

image.description: Docker image name. Must include tag.
image.title: Image

registry.description: The container registry URLs that this container should be pulled from. Will default to Dockerhub if none is specified.
registry.title: Registry

workdir.description: The working directory the entrypoint command of the container runsin. This is used to determine where to load artifacts when running in the container.
workdir.title: Workdir

DockerConfig.title: DockerConfig

Function.description: A Function with a single or a script.

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.
annotations.title: Annotations

name.description: Function name. Must be unique within a plugin.
name.title: Name

description.description: Function description. A short human readable description for this function.
description.title: Description

command.description: Full shell command for this function. Each function accepts only one command. The command will be executed as a shell command in plugin. For running several commands after each other use && between the commands or pipe data from one to another using |
command.title: Command

language.description: Programming language of the script. Currently only Python is supported.

source.description: Source contains the source code of the script to execute.
source.title: Source

Function.title: Function

FunctionArrayInput.description:
A JSON array input.

You can add additional validation by defining a JSONSchema specification.

See http://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/array.html for
more information.

annotations.title: Annotations

default.description: Default value to use for an input if a value was not supplied.
default.title: Default

alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.
alias.title: Alias

required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.
required.title: Required

spec.description: An optional JSON Schema specification to validate the input value. You can use validate_spec method to validate a value against the spec.
spec.title: Spec

items_type.description: Type of items in an array. All the items in an array must be from the same type.

FunctionArrayOutput.description:
Function array output.

This output loads the content from a JSON file which must be a JSON Array.

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.
annotations.title: Annotations

path.description: Path to the output file relative to where the function command is executed.
path.title: Path

required.description: A boolean to indicate if an artifact output is required. A False value makes the artifact optional.
required.title: Required

items_type.description: Type of items in this array. All the items in an array must be from the same type.

FunctionFileInput.description:

File is a special string input. Unlike other string inputs, a file will be copied
from its location to execution folder when a workflow is executed.

.. code-block:: python

    # a file with maximum 50 characters with an ``epw`` extension.

        "type": "string",

default.description: The default source for file if the value is not provided.
default.title: Default

alias.description: A list of aliases for this input in different platforms.
alias.title: Alias

required.description: A field to indicate if this input is required. This input needs to be set explicitly even when a default value is provided.
required.title: Required

extensions.title: Extensions

HTTP Source

A web HTTP to an FTP server or an API for example.

IOAliasHandler.description: Input and output alias handler object.

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.
annotations.title: Annotations

language.description: Declare the language (e.g. python, csharp, etc.). This option allows the recipe to be flexible on handling different programming languages.
language.title: Language

module.description: Target module or namespace to load the alias function.
module.title: Module

function.description: Name of the function. The input value will be passed to this function as the first argument.
function.title: Function

index.description: An integer to set the index for the order of execution. This input is only useful when there are more than one handler for the same platform and the output of one handler should be passed to another handler. This is also called chained handlers. By default all the handlers are indexed as 0 assuming they are not chained.
index.title: Index

ItemType.description:
Type enum for items in a list.

Items can not be files or folder. For a list of files you should copy them to a
folder and use FolderInput input instead of using ArrayInput.

PluginConfig.description:
Plugin configuration.

The config is used to schedule functions on a desktop or in other contexts
(ie: Docker).

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.
annotations.title: Annotations

docker.description: The configuration to use this plugin in a docker container

local.description: The configuration to use this plugin locally

PluginConfig.title: PluginConfig

ProjectFolder.description:
Project Folder Source

This is the path to a folder where files and folders can be sourced. In the context
of a desktop run Workflow this folder will correspond to a local folder. In the
context of a workflow run on Pollination this folder will correspond to a Project
scoped folder.

annotations.description: An optional dictionary to add annotations to inputs. These annotations will be used by the client side libraries.
annotations.title: Annotations

path.description: The path to a folder where files and folders can be sourced. For a local filesystem this can be "C:\Users\me\jobs\test".
path.title: Path

key.description: The path inside the bucket to source artifacts from.
key.title: Key

endpoint.description: The HTTP endpoint to reach the S3 bucket.

bucket.description: The name of the S3 bucket on the host server.
bucket.title: Bucket

credentials_path.description: Path to the file holding the AccessKey and SecretAccessKey to authenticate to the bucket. Assumes public bucket access if none are specified.
credentials_path.title: Credentials Path
